titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Walter Jackson Clark was born in Milton on the Hudson, New York, in 1862. He was a graduate of Park College (1881) and the Union Theological Seminary (1891). Reverend Clark was a missionary in Lahore, India.

scopecontent.p: This collection is comprised of photographs and postcards from India (pages from scrapbooks) depicting Tibet, the Himalayas, Lahore, Delhi, Furrakhabad, Calcutta and Bombay. Missionary-related pictures include: the American Presbyterian Church, in Furrakhabad, Indian Christians preaching to mountain villagers near Mussourie and Christian schools in several cities. Other subjects of photos and postcards include village scenes, landscapes and architecture. There are also a small number of printed items and reports related to missions in India and group photographs of North India Mission and Punjab Mission staff and members of the United Church of Northern India as well as a Board of Foreign Missions certificate for Anna Elizabeth Smith and an East Indian Railway booklet about India inscribed "Ruth and Leila Clark."

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
